author: Special Correspondent
text:
They want strict enforcement of ban on use of trawlers and purse seine nets

Fishermen who use country boat from six districts observing a fast at Manamelkudi in Pudukottai district on Wednesday demanding strict enforcement of ban on use of pair trawling and purse seine nets by mechanised boats.

Country boat fishermen of six districts observed a fast at Manamelkudi on Wednesday to press for their demands, including strict enforcement on the ban on use of pair trawling and purse seine nets by mechanised boat fishermen.

Country boat fishermen from Pudukottai, Thanjavur, Nagapattinam, Tiruvarur, Ramanathapuram, and Thoothukudi participated in the agitation.

The agitating fishermen demanded action against mechanised boat fishermen using the banned nets and against Fisheries Department officials who allowed the use of the same.

They demanded action against mechanised boat fishermen who indulged in cutting off nets used by country boat fishermen.

The fishermen alleged that the use of the banned nets was destroying the marine wealth in the Palk Straits endangering the livelihood of the country boat fishermen. Already many species have become extinct.

If the situation continued, the entire marine wealth of the region would be destroyed, they warned. The agitators threatened to intensify their agitation if the government failed to take action on their demands.
title: Country boat fishermen observe fast
